intro: Myodocarpus coronatus, commonly known as the crown fruit tree, is a small evergreen shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashews and mangoes, and is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically covered in a dense, woolly coating. Its botanical features make it unique within its family, with adaptations suited to its native arid and semi-arid environments.
